title: As a general rule, bug report or help/support?
body:
If I've encountered a bug and it had a some negative impact on my account should I just post in the bug report section (and file a ticket as I have)? Or post it here? or both?

Can penalties like for queue dodging or anything else under any circumstances be reversed if you can show that it was a game/client bug and you were making a good faith effort to participate?

replies.body:
You know, I don't expect any answers here but is there any plans to eventually transition the non SR queues to the newer matching subsystem, which as I understand it is the reason why other queues don't support things like pick intent, which would have probably saved me from getting booted in spite of the glitches.

I know SR is the "premier" game mode, but there is something to be said for a consistent UI experience across the entire game.

Of course. I totally understand. That said, it's equally frustrating for me as it is for the other five (or nine) people when I really wanted to play but the client glitched out.

Far as my particular issue I did make sure to include all the log files generated around the time of the incident. And from here I guess my advice to others would be not to assume that an oddity will fix itself, restart the client and/or give it some time.

Totally, I know it's just as frustrating for you.  Is this bug something you've been able to reproduce?  You've got me curious now with this additional info, and I'm wondering if something else is going on.  For example, if this was caused by a bugsplat then the issue could have been caused by a bad driver or game file too.  I'm happy to help troubleshoot if you like, just let me know!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=hNxPdxbB,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-06-08T23:48:26.161+0000)
>
> Totally, I know it's just as frustrating for you.  Is this bug something you've been able to reproduce?  You've got me curious now with this additional info, and I'm wondering if something else is going on.  For example, if this was caused by a bugsplat then the issue could have been caused by a bad driver or game file too.  I'm happy to help troubleshoot if you like, just let me know!

Not consistently, unfortunately.  I have had some similarly strange things happen during champ select (like player name hilights from a previous game being stuck on the screen), but they didn't prevent me from picking/getting into the game.

I h ave a suspicion that this sort of thing can occur if you click on certain things at just the right (wrong?) time. For example, once I had clicked the mastery edit button right as a champ select ended because someone else dodged, and the next game I went into there were graphics out of place. So there's definitely some wonkiness if certain things occur when the client transitions between scenes.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/0if6clckpstlc2q/league%20issue.JPG?dl=0
In this image from the incident that led to me posting, the bottom right player has the red "currently picking" VFX stuck on and not animating when it isn't their turn, because the player in that slot happened to be picking at the time I got booted out the previous time.This is something I've seen multiple times but not 100% of the time. (in 3v3, if two players are still picking, both of them will have the stuck graphics)

I will make a point to take more screenshots when I see this weirdness.

If you confront any bugs, it's super important that it's posted on the bug report boards so QA can investigate it.  If it's something that directly impacted you, it wouldn't hurt to reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  

I can't make any guarantees, but we do like to look at each case individually to see what can be done.  There may be some pushback, though, because dodging and leaving games still cause negative impacts on other players even if unintentional.  Still, hopefully we can work something out!
